poem:
**The Trumpet Voice**

Southampton's sun casts a gilded glow,  
on Mike, who bends time's tinsel thread,  
thirty to forty percent more the tally—  
gold-spun wigs, spray tan familiarity.  
"I knew he'd win," he says, grinning broad,  
charmed by the echo of a distant fraud,  
his retirement grows with each mimic's grin,  
in Trump's shadow, he's free to begin.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘When I’m not Trump, I’m just Mike’: UK impersonator enjoys re-election boom A British Donald Trump impersonator is looking forward to an “unstoppable” four years, thanking the American president for providing him with a pension pot for his retirement. Southampton-based Mike Osman, a 65-year-old comedian, said his income had increased by between 30 and 40% since Trump was re-elected and he was expecting to have the busiest year of his career. “I knew he’d win". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

Southampton-based Mike Osman, a 65-year-old comedian, said his income had increased by between 30 and 40% since Trump was re-elected and he was expecting to have the busiest year of his career. “I knew he’d win
